body:
This is because you create a new array. [ngValue] compares object identity not data content. If it gets a different object instance, it doesn't consider it the same and doesn't show it as selected.

Either update value in test() to reflect the new selection or don't create a new array but instead just modify the previously created one.

Actually moving 

this.value = this.items[0].value;

to the end of the test() function would fix your problem.

Plunker example
title: Lost selection after binding new items to select
